alert.note: Alert for Bibb; Houston; Jones; Monroe; Twiggs (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 30 at 3:41AM EDT until March 30 at 5:20PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Georgia... Flint River at GA 26 near Montezuma affecting Macon, Dooly and Sumter Counties. Flint River at US 19 near Carsonville affecting Upson, Crawford, Talbot and Taylor Counties. Ocmulgee River at US 341 at Hawkinsville affecting Bleckley and Pulaski Counties. Ocmulgee River near Macon affecting Houston, Jones, Monroe, Bibb and Twiggs Counties. Oconee River at Dublin affecting Washington, Laurens, Wilkinson and Johnson Counties. Oconee River near Oconee affecting Washington, Wilkinson and Johnson Counties. For the Flint River Basin...including Lovejoy, Peachtree City, Fayetteville, Americus, Peachtree City, Woolsey, Sharpsburg, Peachtree City, Peachtree City, Senoia, Griffin, Griffin, Orchard Hill, Molena, Thomaston, Carsonville, Montezuma, Byromville...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Ocmulgee River Basin...including Jackson, Griffin, Juliette, Juliette, Dames Ferry, Macon, Macon, Hawkinsville, Byron, Clinchfield, Hawkinsville, Abbeville, McRae, Scotland, Lumber City... Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Oconee River Basin...including Penfield, Milledgeville, Oconee, Oconee, McIntyre, Irwinton, Oconee, Dublin, Mount Vernon... Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Ocmulgee River near Macon. * WHEN...Until late this afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 19 feet, Minor flooding continues. The Macon Greenway Ocmulgee Heritage Trail will begin to flood in areas just north of the Martin Luther King Boulevard bridge. The public should not use this portion of the trail. In addition...the lowest sections of the Charles Jones Gateway Park will flood. Portions of agricultural lands well downstream will be under two feet of water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:30 AM EDT Thursday the stage was 18.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 2:30 AM EDT Thursday was 24.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this morning and continue falling to 13.4 feet Monday evening. - Flood stage is 18 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
